version_description:
Repeat Yesterday’s Breakfast with One Tap
We know many of you eat the same breakfast most days because it works for you. Tracking that repeat breakfast will be faster and easier with this new update! Quickly track the same breakfast you ate the previous day with a single tap on option located on the main Track page under the Breakfast section.

Find Out Where Your Nutrients Are Coming From
Gold members can now discover which foods have contributed the most to calories, macronutrient and micronutrient totals over time via the “Chart My” options on the Progress tab. For example, easily see which foods you've tracked in the past week have contributed the most carbs or protein to your macro totals to make fine-tuning your diet even easier.

Correcting Mistakes is Even Easier
Swipe left on any food item on the main Track screen to quickly delete a food tracked by mistake.

Various Bug Fixes
This update also includes a variety of bug fixes and improvements to overall stability.
- Bug fixes regarding onboarding
- Bug fixes
- Bug fixes
Minor bug fixes & UI enhancements.
• Bug fixes.

A fresh new coat of paint, Apple Watch updates, and more in this update!

• Updated app colors to a palette we hope reminds you of the healthy and delicious food in your new diet. (Please pass the carrots.)
• Added the ability to track your Goal Weight in app settings.
• Apple Watch updates include complication integration and the ability to track food via dictation.
• Last but not least, this update also includes bug fixes and stability improvements aplenty.

* Enhancements made to the Macronutrient pie chart to make it easier to see your breakdown of carbs, fat and protein.
* For those of you with the latest software updates, we now offer full support for iOS 10.
* Bug fixes and stability improvements aplenty.

* Fixes Apple Watch Food Tracking issue happening for some users.
* Other Minor bug fixes and stability improvements
Minor bug fixes and stability improvements.

* Changed default for new macro charts to "grams consumed over grams objective" instead of "grams left" responding to your requests.
* Minor bug fixes and stability improvements.

New Today Screen Design
We’ve some changes to the today screen design to bring your data to life! Plus we’ve added a new “fruiter” (aka footer) to include some of your favorite Spring fruits & veggies! Read more to see how the design changes will take effect!

Macros, Macros, and Even More Macros!
We have added two macronutrient views to choose from on the today screen. With the tap of a button, you can toggle between the percentage of calories that contribute to your macronutrients and the number of grams you’ve consumed towards your daily goals.

Both of these charts are also now available on the Nutrient Breakdown (just click the “I” in the top right corner), which also has a new look.

On days you’ve previously tracked, you’ll see the pie chart on the today screen and your goals will be available under the Nutrient Breakdown.

Gold members can now also look at how their macro and micronutrients add up for each meal.

Modernized Accessibility Features
The new design also accommodates accessibility features, including adaptable font sizes and voiceover options. You can find configurations for both in the System Settings.

Watch Updates & Other Fixes
Fixed issues with synchronization with the app and complications to make a better watch experience. We’ve also gone ahead and squashed out some bugs.
Fixed a bug affecting registration.
Bug fixes and improvements.

New Motivational Wallpapers!
Because we want you to “Slay all day,” we’ve chosen some of our favorite motivational quotes for you to save to your device and set as your background. Each motivation is hand-drawn and hand-painted by our super talented designer Gracie Wilson. These wallpapers are free for all users. Go to Account > LIVESTRONG.COM Store > Wallpapers, save your favorite work of art to your phone and “Embrace the Journey!”

New Partnership
We’ve partnered with Del Monte® to inspire you to make smarter choices without sacrificing convenience.

Enhanced look and functionality for Workouts section!
Wondering how many calories you burned in your workout? This version now includes the number of calories burned for each individual workout. And, because everyone has a different metabolic rate, the number you see is custom for your body, based on your weight, age, height, and gender. In addition, bug fixes and new motivating images make your experience even more premium than ever.

Fixed crash affecting some users while tracking food.
Fixed a UI glitch on the food tracking search bar for iOS 11 users.

The brand new 8-Week Meal Plan takes the stress out of eating healthy. It gives you healthy snack, meal and recipe suggestions — all designed for balanced macronutrients, delivering between 1,200 and 1,400 calories for women and between 1,600 and 1,800 calories for men. Choose from four dietary preferences: omnivore, vegetarian, vegan and gluten free. The update also features daily workouts from top celebrity trainer Nicky Holender and inspiring motivational messages.

The brand new 8-Week Meal Plan takes the stress out of eating healthy. It gives you healthy snack, meal and recipe suggestions — all designed for balanced macronutrients, delivering between 1,200 and 1,400 calories for women and between 1,600 and 1,800 calories for men. Choose from four dietary preferences: omnivore, vegetarian, vegan and gluten-free. The update also features daily workouts from top celebrity trainer Nicky Holender and inspiring motivational messages.

Newly designed onboarding system with a fresh, modern look and improved functionality:
• Facebook 1-tap login.
• Security and stability improvements.
• Improvements of our support of Dynamic Type and VoiceOver for improved accessibility.
• A new measurement system to allow height and weight input in metric (in addition to imperial).
• More personalized functionality. Pick from four suggested ways -easy, moderate, challenging or extreme- to reach your fitness goals at the right pace for you.
• More user-friendly design for iPad users.
• Interface lift for our Apple Watch app, now offering a simpler 1-tap dictation tracking.
• Also, Apple Watch is now supporting Dynamic Type so you can freely set the font size to your liking.

• Fix a problem that made some gold purchases not reflect correctly. If you are having this problem contact support@livestrong.com.
• Updated our app to comply with the EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).
Fixes an issue on some user sessions.
Bug Fixes.

We found a few bugs dieting and working out inside our app. They got very strong and healthy, but we worked hard to crush them for you!

* The bug that got some of you logged out has been sprayed to death.
* The bug that made some of your data disappear got under our broom.
* The bug that messed with our Workouts calculations has been contained.

Bonus: We made sure our Workouts calorie burn values are correctly tailored accurate to your body!

We are committed to making your life better. In this version, we improved our gold subscription purchase process by making it easier to understand with upfront and precise pricing and terms. Additionally, we fixed a few minor bugs reported by our users.

Fixes for time travelers who are having problems with the app.
Facebook Sign-in issues have also been resolved.
Additional minor bugfixes to improve your experience in the app.

We've made improvements to the accessibility of our Meal Plans diary so it is easier to navigate with VoiceOver.
And other than that, we are eating nothing but bugs so you don't have to live with them in the app :P

In contrast to our previous releases, this update is a small one. Quite simply, we’ve fixed a bug to our Notification service to make it more consistent, efficient and reliable.
As always, we’re always here to help! If you’ve come across a problem, want to provide feedback or require support, you can get in touch by email support@livestrong.com
If you love MyPlate and find it useful, why not help us spread the word about us – letting people in a similar situation to you know about our service – by leaving a review – even if you’ve already done so for a previous version of the app.

ALL our users deserve a better experience. For that reason, we are bringing improved advertising to the free version of the app. We hope that better quality (and awesome looking!) ads make them more enjoyable while they keep supporting our development.
Additionally, we have optimized the app to work and look great on iOS 12 and the iPhone XS, iPhone XS Max, and Apple Watch Series 4.
Also, we continued dancing day and night on top of​ our bugs. We find this is a fun way to destroy them, and it is also a great workout. Join our dance by updating your app and enjoying an even more stable experience!

We took your requests to heart and today we’re finally able to answer the question “What should I eat?”. All users will be able to access the app’s FREE new Recipes feature, which will serve up personalized healthy recipe suggestions for breakfast, lunch and dinner based on your calorie expenditure that day AND your dietary preferences (Omnivore, Pescetarian, Vegetarian and Vegan).

We want to make cooking and meal planning easy for you no matter what your health goal is. Daily meal inspiration will be served up in the form of irresistible recipes like 4-Ingredient Banana Pancakes, Mark Sisson’s Ultimate Keto Salad, Chicken Pad Thai Zoodles and more.

The best part? Each recipe was created by a registered dietician to contain balanced macronutrients that fit your lifestyle and goals. So don’t blame us if you become a master chef and achieve your health goals in 2019.
This version includes minor bug fixes and improvements to the receipt service.

In contrast to our previous releases, this update is a small one. Quite simply, we’ve fixed a bug to our Notification service to make it more consistent, efficient and reliable.
As always, we’re always here to help! If you’ve come across a problem, want to provide feedback or require support, you can get in touch by email support@livestrong.com
If you love MyPlate and find it useful, why not help us spread the word about us – letting people in a similar situation to you know about our service – by leaving a review – even if you’ve already done so for a previous version of the app.

We take your feedback to heart! We really do. So, in our latest release we focused on bug fixes and improvements to both the free and paid versions of MyPlate to ensure the best possible app experience. We hope you’ll find this version to be more consistent, efficient and reliable.

Curious? Here’s a list of some of the improvements we implemented:

1. We fixed bugs that prevented Sodium and Cholesterol from displaying the correct micronutrient values.

2. For the custom foods you create, we resolved a synchronization issue that was preventing these foods from being displayed.

3. Now when you track a food, we’ve improved the look and experience of the Food Detail screen. Not only did we add a cleaner, more contemporary design, we focused on improving two key aspects:

3.1 Improved Nutritional Facts label:
For the free version of the app, we kept the same functionality but made it better in terms of visibility and design. The Nutritional Facts Label displays the macro & micro nutrients breakdown of the food relevant to a 2,000 calorie diet. We also enhanced the look of this label and made it easier to see the values at a glance. And it’s now easier for you to see this label since it’s displayed directly on the Food Details screen.
For the paid version of the app, we implemented a new feature we’re calling Smart Nutritional Facts Label, which shows you nutrition information as a percent of your daily goals! As a premium user, you can now see the macro and micro breakdown of the food you track as it relates to your personal caloric and nutritional goals. This will help you understand the percentage of calories, carbs, fat, protein, cholesterol, sodium, etc... as you track toward your daily goals.

3.2 Important new functionality: You can now re-assign a food from one meal to another. How often have you accidently tracked a food for lunch that was actually meant to be logged as breakfast or dinner? Now you can easily re-assign that food to the right meal with just couple of taps by using the new action button: Meal.

As always, we’re here to help! If you’ve come across a problem, want to provide feedback, or require support, you can get in touch with us by email: support@livestrong.com

If you love MyPlate and find it useful, please help us spread the word! Let other people with similar diet and fitness goals know about our service by leaving a review in the app store: https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/myplate-calorie-counter/id502317923?mt=8

We truly appreciate hearing from you and all those reviews actually help us improve the product so YOU get the best calorie tracker app possible!

Your feedback matters! We want to provide you a better experience when creating your own food so in this release we focused on bug fixes and UI/UX improvements for Custom Foods.

Here is a summary with the big changes we made:
- We have consolidated the different flows for creating a custom food in one unified experience. No matter if you want to Quick Add some calories or you want to get more in depth and add macro and micro nutrient information, now you can do it in the same form.
- We modernized the look and feel for the Custom Foods form! We hope you will enjoy the new layout and your tracking experience will be more streamlined.

Other smaller improvements we performed included bug fixes and small UI tweaks:
- We fixed the issues around the barcode scanner on all devices, including iPad devices.
- We fixed a small bug that was preventing custom foods to show up in My Foods tab.
- We performed small UI tweaks on the Food Details screen so you can always have the caloric value in view.
- We also brought back the brand information in the title of the food responding to your needs.
- We fixed a bug where exercises were tracked unexpectedly in some situations.

As always, we’re here to help! If you’ve come across a problem, want to provide feedback, or require support, you can get in touch with us by email: support@livestrong.com

If you love MyPlate and find it useful, please help us spread the word! Let other people with similar diet and fitness goals know about our service by leaving a review in the App Store. We truly appreciate hearing from you and all those reviews actually help us improve the product so YOU get the best calorie tracker app possible!

We have an exciting new release for you! We’ve put a lot of love (and effort) into bringing you major improvements to our Food Search.

- We have made its interface clearer and more reliable so you have a better experience finding the foods you want to track.
- We have focused on ensuring this feature is great for every user. Food search now:
-- supports larger font sizes (as we currently do in many other parts of our app).
-- is fully accessible for VoiceOver users.

But that’s not all, our improvements to accessibility reach many other areas in the app such as Water and Weight tracking, but also include refinements for Food Tracking and our Home Page.

As always, we’re here to help! If you’ve come across a problem, want to provide feedback, or require support, you can get in touch with us by email at support@livestrong.com.

If you love MyPlate and find it useful, please help us spread the word! Let other people with similar diet and fitness goals know about our service by leaving a review in the App Store. We truly appreciate hearing from you and all those reviews actually help us improve the product so YOU get the best calorie tracker app possible!

Big news in food tracking! Our goal is to make tracking your food as easy as possible, and we’ve made some great improvements with this release.
- We’ve redesigned the Recently Tracked, My Food and My Meals tabs, keeping the spirit of the design you know and love, but making it cleaner and easier to read.
- Tracking foods from your Recently Tracked list is faster than ever! With the new “Quick Track” option, track food from your Recent list by tapping the plus sign to the right of the food item. Made a mistake? Delete foods from your “Tracked for Today” list by tapping the checkmark to the right of the food item.
- Editing and deleting custom entries from your My Food and My Meals lists can now be done with a quick swipe to the left.
- Accessibility is important to us, so we’ve extended Dynamic Type to support food tracking and VoiceOver navigation has been enhanced.
As always, we’re here to help! If you’ve come across a problem, want to provide feedback, or require support you can get in touch with us by sending an email to support@livestrong.com.

We truly appreciate hearing from you and your reviews actually help us improve the product so YOU get the best calorie tracker app possible!

We are bringing you a new version that addresses the valuable feedback you gave us on our latest changes to the food tracking experience: A more meaningful sort of your recently tracked foods.
With it, we have also improved the performance of the app when entering food tracking to get you going even faster! And, lastly, a little surprise pro-user feature: We added a new gesture to quick-track in the "recent" tab: Swipes on recent/tracked foods will add/remove them from your daily consumption. Almost like the old days, but better.
As always, we’re here to help! If you’ve come across a problem, want to provide feedback, or require support you can get in touch with us by sending an email to support@livestrong.com.

Here's a new version of our app addressing:
- the response time of the app opening the food tracking that affected some of our most active users.
- the "done" button issue that prevented some iPad users in iOS 13 to exit the food tracking.

Version 5.21.0 includes a new way to sign in and some efficiency tweaks!

MyPlate now offers Sign in with Apple! Sign in with Apple allows you to sign in to your account with the tap of a button, using the Apple ID you already have. This fast and secure way to access your account means you no longer need to worry about remembering account and password information.

We’ve also done some fine tuning to make the app run more smoothly on iOS 13.

As always, we’re here to help! If you’ve come across a problem, want to provide feedback, or require support you can get in touch with us by sending an email to support@livestrong.com.

We truly appreciate hearing from you, and your reviews actually help us improve our product so YOU get the best calorie tracker app possible!

New year, new us!

As we prepare to head into a new year, we’re introducing color changes in the app that will make MyPlate accessible for ALL users. The color updates in this release are our first pass at creating a friendlier and cleaner design. The new-look features improved color contrast which makes text easier to read, providing an overall improvement in user experience.

In other news, Dark Mode is here! MyPlate now fully supports Dark Mode, which helps reduce eye strain and offers an alternative and fun way to view the app.

As always, we’re here to help! If you’ve come across a problem, want to provide feedback, or require support you can get in touch with us by sending an email to support@livestrong.com.

With this update, we’ve increased the list of nutrients that are exportable from MyPlate to Apple’s HealthKit. When available, you’ll now be able to view Vitamins A & C in the Health app.

In addition, we’ve squashed a few pesky bugs and have improved the stability and security of the app. Lastly, we resolved a bug affecting the read/unread status of community notifications. Never miss a reply from your in-app fit fam!

In this release, we’re beginning work on improving our food search tool. Our end goal is to ensure that you can find the foods you eat, every time. We hope that you will provide feedback so that we can continue working to improve this vital part of the app.

In this release, we’ve resolved a few pesky bugs and done some housekeeping. The bugs we’ve squashed are:
* A bug causing duplicate activity imports from Apple Health has been resolved.
* Tracking a zero calorie food will once again highlight the meal period you’ve tracked to.
We’ve also improved the barcode scanner experience, making it easier to access.

Here is a tiny release to fix a newly introduced bug in our latest version 5.25.1. With this new update you will not be seeing any wrong values on your weight tracking. Also, rest assured this was only a display quirk, and your nutritional and weight data are correct and safe in MyPlate. Thanks for helping us make MyPlate better everyday.

As always, we’re here to help! If you’ve come across a problem, want to provide feedback, or require support you can get in touch with us by sending an email to support@livestrong.com.

Our latest update includes several changes that will make tracking your food easier and more precise!

First, we’ve added a decimal option under the servings input when tracking a food item. Now you can get the most accurate reading possible of your daily intake.

Second, we’ve added an easier way to filter recipes in your personalized recipe feed. You now have the option to choose recipes from different meal periods, as well as tailor them to your dietary preference.

Third, we’ve made many improvements to our app to ensure the most delightful pointer support in iPadOS.

Lastly, we added support for users who have activated the “differentiate without color” accessibility feature on their devices. This improves the readability of out macronutrient breakdowns!

As always, we’re here to help! If you’ve come across a problem, want to provide feedback, or require support you can get in touch with us by sending an email to support@livestrong.com.

If you love MyPlate and find it useful, please help us spread the word! Let other people with similar diet and fitness goals know about our service by leaving a review in the App Store. We truly appreciate hearing from you and your reviews actually help us improve the product so YOU get the best calorie tracker app possible!

Net Carbs are Here!

This release comes with a very exciting new feature! We’ve added Net Carbs to the Nutritional Label for our Gold users. We have heard your requests for net carbs and are so happy to finally offer them. Please note that our calculation does not take sugar alcohols into consideration.

We’ve also made some behind-the-scenes improvements to keep the app running smoothly.

As always, we’re here to help! If you’ve come across a problem, want to provide feedback, or require support you can get in touch with us by sending an email to support@livestrong.com.

We're back with the most exciting food tracking update! This version of the app will allow you to take a more detailed look at what's in the food you're eating. In this release, we've begun adding support for Vitamin and Mineral tracking for our Gold users. We've started to roll out vitamins A and C, and we are going to be expanding this list in the near future. Stay tuned!

We've also made a few style and accessibility tweaks to the Nutrition Facts table, as well as done some tidying up behind the scenes.

As always, we’re here to help! If you’ve come across a problem, want to provide feedback, or require support you can get in touch with us by sending an email to support@livestrong.com.

We truly appreciate hearing from you and your reviews actually help us improve the product so YOU get the best calorie tracker app possible!

Exclusive MyPlate Widgets For iOS 14 Are Here!

We are thrilled to announce the release of MyPlate widgets for iOS 14! Home screen widgets allow you to view timely information about your day at a glance and will help you stay on top of your nutrition all day, every day.

With two options for displaying MyPlate widgets on the home screen of your device, you are in control of how you view your data. Need to focus on a specific macronutrient? Our small widget can display calories, fat, protein or carbs with a quick tap. Our larger widget gives you a broader picture of your daily tracking and displays calories and macronutrients.
Our next step is to increase the options for displayable nutrients on our widgets and we want to hear from you! What nutrients are most important for you to keep a close eye on? Send us a note at support@livestrong.com and let us know!

Ah! And 5.29.1 fixes our medium widget so your calorie goal is calculated with your net intake.

If you love MyPlate and find it useful, please help us spread the word! Let other people with similar diet and fitness goals know about our service by leaving a review in the App Store. We truly appreciate hearing from you and your reviews actually help us improve the product so YOU get the best calorie tracker app possible!

This tiny release comes with some light housekeeping and under-the-hood-improvements to keep the app in tip top shape.

As always, we’re here to help! If you’ve come across a problem, want to provide feedback, or require support you can get in touch with us by sending an email to support@livestrong.com.

If you love MyPlate and find it useful, please help us spread the word! Let other people with similar diet and fitness goals know about our service by leaving a review in the App Store. We truly appreciate hearing from you and your reviews actually help us improve the product so YOU get the best calorie tracker app possible!

With this minor version update we bring a fix so calories and calories from fat update properly as soon as you change your servings. Other than that, the real awesomeness came in the previous major release, so, read ahead! :D

This update comes with a complete revamp of our Progress section! We’ve traded the old view for an easy-to-read and fully accessible feed view, making it easier to view your progress for the nutrients that matter most to you. We’ve also unlocked a Gold feature, allowing ALL users to view daily averages for nutrients over any amount of time.

With our design changes comes a new Progress home screen, divided into two sections - Highlights and Today. In the Highlights section, you’ll see a caloric snapshot of the last 7 days, and your top food sources. In the Today section, we display the most important nutrients, plus water, weight and BMI. Use our handy new search tool located at the top of the screen to view additional nutrients. Tapping on a nutrient will lead you to a detailed page of progress over time and important nutrient information.

In addition to our design changes, we’ve also done the following:
* Added all vitamins and minerals that come with our Gold membership to the Progress section, allowing our Gold members to view progress over time for everything - from fat, carbs and protein, to vitamins, minerals and net carbs!
* Changed how we aggregate and average your data within the Progress charts.
* Added a search tool so you can easily find the data that is most important to you.

As always, we’re here to help! If you’ve come across a problem, want to provide feedback, or require support you can get in touch with us by sending an email to support@livestrong.com.

If you love MyPlate and find it useful, please help us spread the word! Let other people with similar diet and fitness goals know about our service by leaving a review in the App Store. We truly appreciate hearing from you and your reviews actually help us improve the product so YOU get the best calorie tracker app possible!

In our last release, we promised there was more to come for our Progress re-design, and we're back with the next phase! With the release of version 5.31.0, we're expanding our Progress home screen to include a Favorites section.

Need to pay attention to sodium or cholesterol? Simply tap the favorite icon on any nutrient to give it a permanent spot at the top of your Progress home screen. Be sure to upgrade to our Gold membership to take advantage of this brand new Gold feature.

We've also tweaked a few of the graphs in the Progress section! Our Weight and BMI graphs have a new design that will better reflect smaller fluctuations, giving you a sharper picture of your progress. They'll also always be present in the Today section, so you won't have to search to view these important metrics. In addition, the Calories graph will display net calories instead of consumed.

As always, we’re here to help! If you’ve come across a problem, want to provide feedback, or require support you can get in touch with us by sending an email to support@livestrong.com.

If you love MyPlate and find it useful, please help us spread the word! Let other people with similar diet and fitness goals know about our service by leaving a review in the App Store. We truly appreciate hearing from you and your reviews actually help us improve the product so YOU get the best calorie tracker app possible!

We’ve been busy working behind the scenes to keep things running smoothly! Version 5.32.0 comes with some minor bug fixes, including a fix to ensure your macro charts are displayed correctly. A few other under the hood improvements have been made as well.


As always, we’re here to help! If you’ve come across a problem, want to provide feedback, or require support you can get in touch with us by sending an email to support@livestrong.com
